    • Uses of SceneNode in sage.app

      Methods in sage.app that return types with arguments of type SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Iterable<SceneNode> BaseGame.getGameWorld()
      Returns an Iterable collection of the SceneNodes in the game world used by BaseGame.
      Methods in sage.app with parameters of type SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void BaseGame.addGameWorldObject(SceneNode obj)
      addGameWorldObject() adds a SceneNode object to the game world managed by the BaseGame class.
      protected boolean BaseGame.removeGameWorldObject(SceneNode obj)
      removeGameWorldObject() the specified SceneNode object from the game world managed by the BaseGame class if the object exists in the game world.
      Method parameters in sage.app with type arguments of type SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void BaseGame.setGameWorld(java.util.ArrayList<SceneNode> gameWorld)
      Sets the GameWorld used by BaseGame to the specified ArrayList.

      Removes the specified SceneNode from this AbstractCamera's HUD, if the element is present in the HUD.

    • Uses of SceneNode in sage.input

      Methods in sage.input that return SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SceneNode ThirdPersonCameraController.getTarget()
      Returns the SceneNode which is the current target of the camera (that is, the SceneNode that the camera looks at.
      Methods in sage.input with parameters of type SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ThirdPersonCameraController.setTarget(SceneNode target)
      Causes the specified SceneNode to become the target of the camera being controlled -- meaning that the camera will subsequently always "look at" the specified SceneNode.
      Constructors in sage.input with parameters of type SceneNode 
      Constructor and Description
      ThirdPersonCameraController(ICamera cam, SceneNode target, IInputManager inputMgr, java.lang.String inputControllerName)
      Constructs a ThirdPersonCameraController that allows orbiting the specified camera around the specified target SceneNode using the controls provided by the specified IInputManager and input controller.

    • Uses of SceneNode in sage.renderer

      Methods in sage.renderer with parameters of type SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void IRenderer.addToRenderQueue(SceneNode s)
      Adds the specified SceneNode to the rendering queue specified by the SceneNode.RENDER_MODE of the SceneNode.

    • Uses of SceneNode in sage.renderer.jogl

      Methods in sage.renderer.jogl with parameters of type SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void JOGLRenderer.addToRenderQueue(SceneNode n)
      Adds the specified SceneNode to the appropriate render queue (based on the SceneNode.RENDER_MODE of the SceneNode), after first checking to see whether the SceneNode can be culled (omitted from further processing) based on the SceneNode.CULL_MODE of the node.
      void JOGLActiveRenderer.addToRenderQueue(SceneNode s) 

    • Uses of SceneNode in sage.scene

      Subclasses of SceneNode in sage.scene 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Group
      A Group is a SceneNode which has no screen representation but rather contains a set of (zero or more) children, each of which can in turn be a SceneNode -- meaning either another (sub-)Group or a Leaf.
      class  HUDImage
      HUDImage defines a HUDObject which consists of a Texture mapped Rectangle located in the camera's viewport.
      class  HUDObject
      HUDObject defines a SceneNode which resides on the "HUD" (Heads-Up Display) -- that is, on the screen "in front of" normal Scenegraph (game-world) objects.
      class  HUDString
      HUDString defines a HUDObject which consists of a String.
      class  Leaf
      This class is an abstraction for SceneNodes which are leaves of the gameworld scenegraph; it defines functionality common to all types of scenegraph Leaf nodes.
      class  Model3DTriMesh
      Model3DTriMesh extends TriMesh by incorporating support for model animation data and an associated Texture.
      class  SkyBox
      A SkyBox is a Group made of textured quads that simulates having a sky, horizon and ground around a scene.
      class  TriMesh
      TriMesh defines a Leaf consisting of a geometric object made up of triangles defined by a collection of vertices, together with attributes associated with the vertices.
      Fields in sage.scene with type parameters of type SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Vector<SceneNode> Controller.controlledNodes 
      Methods in sage.scene that return SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SceneNode Group.getChild(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a reference to the first child node with the specified name, or null if no such child exists in the Group.
      SceneNode SceneNode.getParent()
      Returns a reference to the parent of this SceneNode.
      SceneNode Group.removeChild(SceneNode target)
      removes the specified SceneNode from the child list of this group.
      Methods in sage.scene that return types with arguments of type SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Iterator<SceneNode> Group.getChildren()
      Returns an object of type Iterator which can be used to access the children of this Group.
      java.util.Iterator<SceneNode> Group.iterator()
      Returns an object of type Iterator which iterates over the SceneNodes of this Group's children.
      Methods in sage.scene with parameters of type SceneNode 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Group.addChild(SceneNode s)
      Adds the specified SceneNode to the list of children of this Group.
      void Controller.addControlledNode(SceneNode s) 
      boolean Group.contains(SceneNode child)
      Returns true if the specified SceneNode is directly a child of this Group; false otherwise.
      SceneNode Group.removeChild(SceneNode target)
      removes the specified SceneNode from the child list of this group.
      void SceneNode.setParent(SceneNode parent)
      Assigns a new parent to this SceneNode.

    • Uses of SceneNode in sage.scene.shape

      Subclasses of SceneNode in sage.scene.shape 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Cube
      Cube defines a Leaf representing a cube made up of a list of vertices, a list of faces (each of which is a list of four indices into the vertex list), and a list of face colors corresponding in order to the faces in the face list.
      class  Cylinder
      Cylinder defines a Leaf which is a cylinder of a specified height and radius.
      class  Line
      Line defines an object which is a line between two 3D points.
      class  Polygon3D
      Defines a Leaf which is a 3D polygon - that is, a collection of 3D vertices.
      class  Polyhedron3D
      Polygon3D is a Leaf with a color and a type.
      class  Pyramid
      This class defines a Pyramid which is a TriMesh made up of six colored triangles: four describing the triangular pyramid faces, and two describing the bottom.
      class  Quad
      Quad defines a four sided, two dimensional shape (a quadrilateral) lying flat in the Z=0 plane by default.
      class  Rectangle
      Rectangle defines a Polygon3D which is a rectangle with its four corners positioned symmetrically about the origin at the center of the rectangle.
      class  Sphere
      Defines a Leaf which is a sphere.
      class  Square
      Defines a square with dimensions 1x1 centered at the origin and lying flat in Z=0.
      class  Teapot
      This class defines the classic "Newell Teapot" (Google it).

    • Uses of SceneNode in sage.terrain

      Subclasses of SceneNode in sage.terrain 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  TerrainBlock
      TerrainBlock defines a single section of terrain.
      class  TerrainPage
      TerrainPage defines a quad tree of terrain components; each TerrainPage will have four children, either four TerrainPages or four TerrainBlocks.
